steps.title: Step 1: Creating a Scratch Org
steps.body:
We are going to create a new 'Scratch Org', which is an ephemeral dev environnement.
We will use it to creare our app, but also to experience how Salesforce DX allows collaboratoive development, Continuous Integration and Continous Deployment.

steps.title: Step 2: Prepare Account Data Model
steps.body:
Follow the instructions to create the data model yourself in your org.
Then you can finalize the model by pushing the metadata defined here.

steps.title: Step 3: Create Factoring Custom Objects, Relationships, Layout and Global Picklist Values
steps.body:
In this step we will create Custom Objects for the Factoring Request and Response. The data model contains all needed fields and relationships. Furthermore also the necessary layouts are deployed. In addition we are preparing global picklists to have one single point of truth in the datamodel and the later program code.
Again, if you want to have a loook at the metadata please have a look

steps.title: Step 4: Create Tabs and Application
steps.body:
Nice, now we have the data model defined. And the Salesforce Platform is doing the rest .... of course API and UI generation. So in this Step we will generate new UI Access points (Tabs) and a seperate Application?
We could also create more sexy lists views and custom page layouts.
Let's get to work!
Final metadata

steps.title: Step 5: Integration
steps.body:
We now need to integrate the provided WebServices! For that we will generate the Stubs in APEX out of the xsd. With that we are able to implement services that are available via code but also in all Point&Click places of the Platform.
Let's use the Lightning Process Builder to make life easier for our users.
